subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove and today I'd like to talk to you about
"Psychotronics". One of the reasons, frankly, for this
presentation on this topic today is to let you know that I am one of the invited guest speakers for the U.S.
Psychotronics
Association 40th annual convention. I'll be speaking on July 21st
2018 and their conference is in Chicago. There is going to be a link
that you will find, if you check the links in the upper right-hand corner
associated of this- video associated with this video-
you'll see a link to information about the conference itself. Now I should mention, as well,
there's going to be a link to an interview I did a few months ago with Dr.
Beverly Rubik who is the President of the U.S.
Psychotronics
Association.
We did a regular "New Thinking Allowed" half-hour
video
conversation about psychotronics, so if you're confused
that's a real good place to go. Basically, psychotronics has to do with the interface between human
consciousness and various types of instrumentation. And when I say human consciousness, I'm
talking about
parapsychological
abilities.
There's also, I'm going to show you-and attached right to this very video- two short videos I made with
Dr. Rubik.
In one of them
I explain a little bit about what I plan to speak about at the conference, and in the other, she talks in more general terms
about the conference itself. So those videos are going to be embedded right here in this "In Presence"
monologue. It's the first time I've done that-embedded other videos- but I think it's called for in this occasion.
And I'm hopeful that some of you who are really interested in the kind of material I've been presenting on
the "In Presence" monologues and the "New Thinking Allowed" channel might wish to attend the event, and perhaps I'll
actually get to meet some of you there. That would be nice.
Now
let me just add one other point about
Psychotronics. I do have a bias,
frankly, and it's related to this- that throughout MY career,
I've had many opportunities to work with various forms of
technology and I personally have passed up on all of them. I've often felt that the real
technology is the human body itself. What a vast instrument.
It's gotten multiple antennas for information through all kinds of
channels, including psychic channels.
So that's been my focus. I haven't ever really
developed a professional interest in
any kind of
technological
instrumentation that
interfaces with the human being. Other than the fact, like most of you, I use a computer, of course. <laughs>
And I remember the days when people didn't have personal computers
But that was long ago.
So for me, I tend to think of psychotronics
instrumentation
kind of like a pencil. You know
If you have a pencil and a piece of paper,
you can perform long division and very complicated problems and
mathematics and arithmetic that are quite hard
for me to do, at least, without a pencil. It's not as if the pencil is doing the arithmetic. The pencil just
helps you go through step by step what needs to be done and my sense
Is that a lot of the devices that pass these days for radionics and psychotronics
instrumentation functions that way- very much like a pencil.
Now, I know that there going to be people out there who are going to disagree and who are going to say,
"Well, there's a particular
crystalline
frequency that is activated that opens up the chakras, and therefore is conducive to the etheric energy field
promoting a particular type of
psychological,
psychotronic,
psychokinetic, or telekinetic effect." And I could well be wrong. I'm certainly open to learning about those possibilities.
I do know this, that at Stanford Research
Institute where they did so much pioneering research on Remote Viewing
starting in the 1970s, and going for several decades, two decades
approximately, now that I think about it-
they worked in the Radio-electronics Laboratory where they had a sealed room.
I've been in it and done Remote Viewing in that room. It is sealed in the sense that
electromagnetic signals don't get inside so it's quiet. You know, normally you and I are
existing in an environment where there must be dozens and dozens, if not hundreds, or thousands of
electromagnetic signals from all sorts of transmitters passing right through our bodies and our nervous systems and our brains.
Well we don't hear it,
we don't see it normally. But it creates a kind of subtle noise. And there is quite a bit of
research suggesting that when you are in a quiet environment, in terms of physical distractions but also
electromagnetic noise and even geomagnetic noise, when you can be shielded from all of that and maybe even
distant signals coming from the center of our galaxy.
When we can shield ourselves from all of that, psychic functioning does seem to be better.
So there's a lot to be said in that direction as well.
But for now, I'm going to
insert the two videos with myself and Dr. Rubik to which I referred:
Hello and welcome I'm Dr. Beverly Rubik,
President of the United States Psychotronics Association, and with me today is Dr
Jeffrey Mishlove who's host and producer of the "New Thinking Allowed"
television series. Mishlove: And who will be a speaker at your forthcoming
conference. Rubik: and who's one of our distinguished invited speakers at the upcoming
USPA 40th annual conference
in July 2018. Mishlove: Well, I think Beverly, one of the
topics that I'm gonna bring up will be my 10-year research project
with a man who called himself the P.K. man, P.K. meaning
psychokinesis. And during my study of him, he produced a hundred and sixty-eight
different demonstrations of large-scale
psychokinesis, or mind-over-matter,
involving such things as hurricanes, tornadoes, earthquakes,
power blackouts, and roughly two-thirds of those
events occurred as he predicted they would. He sent out written predictions to scientists, including
myself, that he intended to cause these events. And
then,
The subsequent follow-up was in the newspapers about things that actually happened, and these were unlikely events.
Sometimes they were heat spells in the middle of winter, and cold spells in the middle of summer, or ending droughts, or
controlling the direction of hurricanes. It's quite an amazing testament to the human psyche. He may be
one of the most powerful examples of
psychokinesis known in the history of
parapsychology research. And I think for people interested in
psychotronics, it's very interesting to see what the human mind is capable of doing. And I'll talk also about the
techniques that he used. He created what he called the P.K. Map,
special drawings
filled with symbols in order to accomplish these feats. I think
those who attend the conference will find it quite interesting. Rubik: Oh Jeffrey, this sounds fantastic.
Well, we look forward to hearing you.
So join us in July 2018 for our 40th Annual United States Psychotronics Association Conference.
Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. I'm here with Dr. Beverly Rubik, the President of the United States
Psychotronic
Association. Beverly and I will both be speakers at the annual convention of the
Association to be held in July of 2018 in
Chicago.
Hello Beverly. Rubik: Hi Jeffrey. It's such a pleasure to have you as an invited speaker to our event. Mishlove: I'm happy to be there.
I think I have some interesting things to share about my specialty,
Parapsychology, which a course is closely related to Psychotronics.
Rubik: Absolutely, and the theme of this year's conference is “Mind, Matter and Ether and
Applications to Radionics" So we're looking at really the foundations of what really is mind and matter and that
sacred combination. And what's the nature of space anyway?
We're going back to older ideas of science, but even mystical ideas and
indigenous concepts of ether, of
primordial
very sublime material that filled the universe
in which we interact. Mishlove: And there will be many speakers at the conference
I know.
Rubik: We have a very large slate of invited speakers this year and then several of our board members are also
speaking on quite a wide variety of topics.
Mishlove: Psychotronics for those who may not know, is a field that combines technology
with
Psychology. And
Psychology in the deep sense of the human soul. Rubik: Yes, but we also go beyond that. Certainly, we have
instrumentation and how mind machine couples. But we're really interested fundamentally in the nature of
consciousness and how it can manifest things psychically, from psychokinesis to
other aspects of so-called paranormal or psi. Mishlove: So people who are
interested in knowing what's going on in the cutting edge of this very
complex, exotic, and interesting field would wish to attend the conference. Rubik: Yes,
it's open not just to our membership but to anyone who wants to come. The dates are July 20th through the 22nd
2018 in Deerfield, Illinois. We also have some pre-conferences on
Introduction Radionics, and we'll have some post-conference workshops which are more advanced. Mishlove: And the video will show the link to your website.
Rubik: Yes, and I must say the United States Psychotronics Association has produced an enormous
number of videos. This is our 40th annual conference. We have videos from distinguished experts,
historically, that have passed on in our archives. So, if you become a member you have access to all of these wonderful resources.
Mishlove: Thank You, Beverly. I look forward to seeing you in Chicago in July and hopefully many viewers of this video
will be there as well.
Rubik: Thank you, Jeffrey. We look forward to seeing you there.
Ok, I'm back now and I hope you enjoyed those two segments.
I hope for those of you who have a serious interest, I hope you'll consider attending the Psychotronics
Conference. Maybe I'll meet you there.
But let me leave you with this thought:
Since you have been watching these“In Presence” videos and New Thinking Allowed videos on
Parapsychology, would you be interested in taking it to the next step? If you could develop a
parapsychological talent, with or without the help of a device,
would that be of interest to you? What would you use it for?
What would you wish to accomplish if you had such a talent in your life? Now, perhaps
most of you, I'm going to assume, are interested in simply learning about it because this is part of nature.
I believe it is part of nature though some people would say it's supernatural
too. Either way,
some people just want to be knowledgeable about it,
some people want to be able to be some support person for others in their environment.
But, there will be some of you out there who are
Interested in developing it and taking it to another level in your own life for either personal reasons,
or maybe for the benefit of society as a whole. Where do you stand?
I'll leave you with that thought.
Thank you for being with me.
